channel.title: W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group

item.title: [speech-api] Issue with "SpeechSynthesisUtterance.onend": wrong unit for elapsedTime
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesisUtterance/onend

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

In the example, the elapsed time (event.elapsedTime) is printed as if it was milliseconds. But it's in second per specification and implementation.

Specific section or headline?

Examples

What did you expect to see?

console.log('Utterance has finished being spoken after ' + event.elapsedTime + ' seconds.');

Did you test this? If so, how?

Specification: https://wicg.github.io/speech-api/#speechsynthesisevent-attributes

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/speechsynthesisutterance/onend
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesisUtterance/onend
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/speechsynthesisutterance/onend/index.html
  • Last commit: 642d6eb
  • Document last modified: 2021-06-17T03:52:55.000Z

item.title: [speech-api] Issue with "SpeechSynthesis.onvoiceschanged": (short summary here please)
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesis/onvoiceschanged

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

onvoicechanged LIB.. while I reading about it there is lot of value in there, but in my VS code I access only 19 values only

Specific section or headline?

WEB SPEECH API

What did you expect to see?

Wanna to access all the value in onvoicechanged

Did you test this? If so, how?

Yes , through VC code
// Init voices array
let voices = [];

const getVoices = () => {
voices = synth.getVoices();
console.log(voices);
// Loop through voices and create an option for each one
voices.forEach(voice => {
// Create option Element
const option = document.createElement(option);
// Fill option with voice and language
option.textContent = voice.name + (${voice.lang});

    // Set needed option attributes
    option.setAttribute(`data-lang`, voice.lang);
    option.setAttribute(`data-name`, voice.name);

    voiceSelect.appendChild(option);
})

}
getVoices();
if (synth.onvoiceschanged !== undefined) {
synth.onvoiceschanged = getVoices;
}

this. is the code I used to do

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/speechsynthesis/onvoiceschanged
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesis/onvoiceschanged
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/speechsynthesis/onvoiceschanged/index.html
  • Last commit: 0d5312d
  • Document last modified: 2021-06-01T06:05:06.000Z

item.title: [entries-api] Issue with "FileSystemFlags.exclusive": (short summary here please)
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFlags/exclusive

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

define dirEntry is type of FileSystemDirectoryEntry;
the condition that is file: exist, when i use dirEntry .getFile(fileName.{create:true,exclusive :false}.function(fileEntry)=>{
console.log(fileEntry);
});
i find this condition it cant create new file to cover origin file in this page api introduction;

Specific section or headline?

What did you expect to see?

As the page saysï¼Œwhen i use params ,it will cover origin file

Did you test this? If so, how?

the dirEntry is type of FileSystemDirectoryEntry;
i use dirEntry .getFile(fileName.{create:true,exclusive :false}.function(fileEntry)=>{
console.log(fileEntry);
});
i find this condition it cant create new file to cover origin file in this page api introduction;

item.title: [speech-api] Issue with "SpeechSynthesisUtterance.rate": (demo is incomplete)
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesisUtterance/rate

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The html part of the demo is missing

What did you expect to see?

The full working demo

Did you test this? If so, how?

I recreated a working one here.
https://jsfiddle.net/chrisribe/2wt0qn5f/18/

I is based off of this github repo.
https://github.com/mdn/web-speech-api/tree/master/speak-easy-synthesis
